chapter_description.p: The String Type module provides comprehensive tools for creating, manipulating, and analyzing text in Nelson.
It supports conversion between character arrays and string arrays, concatenation, trimming, justification, and case conversion.
The module also includes functions for searching, matching, replacing, and formatting strings, enabling flexible text processing for both simple and complex string operations.

keyword.name: blanks
keyword.description: creates an string of blank characters.

keyword.name: contains
keyword.description: checks if string contains with pattern.

keyword.name: convertCharsToStrings
keyword.description: Convert chars arrays to string arrays.

keyword.name: convertStringsToChars
keyword.description: Convert string arrays to character arrays.

keyword.name: count
keyword.description: Computes the number of occurrences of an pattern.

keyword.name: endsWith
keyword.description: checks if string ends with pattern.

keyword.name: int2str
keyword.description: Convert an integer array to a string

keyword.name: isStringScalar
keyword.description: checks if input is string array with one element.

keyword.name: matches
keyword.description: Determine if pattern matches with strings.

keyword.name: startsWith
keyword.description: checks if string starts with pattern.

keyword.name: strlength
keyword.description: Length of strings in cell of strings or string array.

keyword.name: strncmp
keyword.description: Compares first n characters of strings.

keyword.name: strncmpi
keyword.description: Compares first n characters of strings (case sensitive).
